Create A Phase-Shifted, Tilt-Amplitude Sine Depth Map

Source: R/CreateDepthmap.R
create.depthmap.Rd

Create A Phase-Shifted, Tilt-Amplitude Sine Depth Map

Usage

create.depthmap(
  im,
  mask = NULL,
  sinoid = TRUE,
  tube.thicc = 7,
  tilt = 45,
  dpi = 300,
  start.soil = 0,
  center.offset = 0
)

Arguments

im

input image

mask

indicating which pixels are foreign objects like tape. The mask will be: mask = im[[1]] - im[[2]] if 'RootDetector' format is used

sinoid

set sinoid = TRUE if true depth should be used. Otherwise, tube diameter is ignored.

tube.thicc

Diameter of minirhizotron tubes

tilt

Minirhiztron tube insertion angle (typically 30-45 degrees)

dpi

Image resolution

start.soil

indicates soil boundary 0cm. Can be retrieved from 'SoilSurfE()' but in-situ calibration is recommended

center.offset

rotational center. Set 0 if top facing tube side is perfectly in the middle. Set 1 if upfacing tube is located at the edges

Value

raster image

Examples

data(seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067)
seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067 = terra::rast(seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067)
img = seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067[[2]]
mask = seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067[[1]] - seg_Oulanka2023_Session01_T067[[2]]
mask[mask == 255] <- NA
map = create.depthmap(img,mask,start.soil = 290 )
